intro: Bellevalia makuensis, commonly known as the Maku bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
